comments.body: We should probably also add a couple of tests to verify that indirectly introducing a `Symbol` constrain via `HasField` does not give false warnings. I'm totally aware that this implementation has no chance of producing such bogus warnings. However, if we ever need to move the check past the type checker, for whatever reasons, this would be easy to break.
Makes sense, I'll add a couple of HasField instances & constraints for good measure.

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +-1,3 @@-- Copyright (c) 2020, Digital Asset (Switzerland) GmbH and/or its affiliates.
-- All rights reserved.

@@ -1,1 +24,28 @@class C4 (x: (GHC.Types.Symbol)) where
    -- Not a duplicate of C1, because a parenthesized kind
    -- is not the same as a non-parenthesized kind in GHC-land.

-- @WARN range=29:14-29:20; Reference to Symbol kind
